workflow.name: Control your n8n instance remotely with Telegram bot commands
workflow.description:
This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.

# Your n8n Command Center in a Telegram Chat
Remotely manage and operate your n8n instance from Telegram with powerful admin commands.

This workflow connects your n8n instance with a Telegram Bot, giving you remote control over key admin operations through simple chat commands.

## üì± You can

- List your workflows (**workflows**)

- Execute a workflow (**execute** [name])

- Activate/deactivate workflows (**activate** [name], **deactivate** [name])

- List past executions (**executions** [name])

- Permanently delete archived workflows (**cleanup**)

- Create backups of all your workflows and credentials (**backup**)

- Get help (**help**)

- Get notified when a workflow fails and when n8n instance starts.


This is especially useful for self-hosted instances when you want quick access to your automation environment from your mobile device.


## üìå Notes

- **backup** only works on self-hosted setups.
- **execute**, **activate**, **deactivate**, and **executions** require the workflow name as argument.
- Workflows must contain the appropriate trigger nodes to be executed or activated.
- Commands and arguments are not case sensitive, there is no need to prefix with slash and spaces in the argument name are supported.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup
- Create your credentials for Telegram API and n8n API.
- Edit all Telegram and n8n nodes. Select your credentials on them. On telegram nodes provide your chatid.
- Detailed step-by-step instructions are available in the workflow notes.
- In each workflow that fails and you want to receive a warning, configure this workflow as Error Workflow in its settings.

parameters.text:
=My commands are:


‚ûñ help
List of commands.

‚ûñ cleanup
Deletes all archived workflows.

‚ûñ backup
Backup workflows and credentials.

‚ûñ workflows
List all workflows.

‚ûñ execute <workflow-name>
Execute a workflow.

‚ûñ activate <workflow-name>
Activate a workflow.

‚ûñ deactivate <workflow-name>
Deactivate a workflow.

‚ûñ executions <workflow-name>
List last executions.


üí° To execute a workflow, it must have a trigger node of type "When Executed by Another Workflow". To activate a workflow, it must have a trigger node that supports activation.

parameters.content:
# Telegram n8n Commander
Remotely manage and operate your n8n instance from Telegram with powerful admin commands.

This workflow connects your n8n instance with a Telegram Bot, giving you remote control over key admin operations through simple chat commands.

## Commands
- List your workflows (**workflows**)

- Execute a workflow (**execute** [name])

- Activate/deactivate workflows (**activate** [name], **deactivate** [name])

- List past executions (**executions** [name])

- Permanently delete archived workflows (**cleanup**)

- Create backups of all your workflows and credentials (**backup**)

- Get help (**help**)

- Get notified when a workflow fails and when n8n instance starts.

## Notes
- **execute**, **activate**, **deactivate**, and **executions** require the workflow name as argument.

- To **execute** a workflow, it must have a trigger node of type "When Executed by Another Workflow".

- To **activate** a workflow, it must have a trigger node that supports activation.

- **backup** only works on self-hosted setups.

- Your credentials will be decrypted in the backup file. Please take security precautions when using this file.

- In each workflow that fails and you want to receive a warning, configure this workflow as Error Workflow in its settings.



*(See the Setup note for instructions on how to set up this workflow.)*

# Setup
To set up this workflow you will need credentials for your Telegram bot and for your n8n API. You will need to edit all Telegram Nodes and n8n Nodes.

## Credentials
First of all, let's create the necessary credentials.
You can see instructions on how to create credentials [here.](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/)

### n8n API
- Go to your n8n settings, in the sidebar go to n8n API.
- Click on the Create an API Key button. Then you must give the key a name and save it. Your key will only be displayed at this point; copy it for the next steps.
- Now we can create a credential for the n8n nodes. Create a new n8n API credential and use the key we just created. You will need to configure your server address as well.

### Telegram Bot
- First you need to have a Telegram bot and its token.
- In your Telegram application, start a conversation with @BotFather and send him the command /newbot, follow the steps and then he will create your bot and present your token.
- You will also need your Telegram user's ChatID/UserID. This way we can protect this workflow so that it only responds to you on Telegram. You can use @userinfobot for this, see instructions [here.](https://bigone.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008014894-How-to-get-the-Telegram-user-ID#:~:text=1.,The%20Number%20ID)
- Now in your n8n create a Telegram API type credential using your bot's token.

## Nodes
Now you have what you need to configure the nodes for this workflow.

### n8n Nodes













Edit each of these nodes and in the "Credentials to connect with" field select your n8n credential.

### Telegram Nodes













Edit each of these nodes and in the "Credentials to connect with" field select your telegram credential.
In the "Chat ID", "Restrict to Chat IDs" or "Restrict to User IDs" fields, enter your ChatID.



**Your workflow is ready! Activate it and interact with your bot on Telegram!**

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

generic.label: Creating Error Workflows in n8n

data.details: Execute command allows you to run terminal commands on the computer/server hosting your n8n instance. Useful for executing a shell script or interacting with your n8n instance programmatically via the CLI.

generic.label: How uProc scraped a multi-page website with a low-code workflow
Why this Product Manager loves workflow automation with n8n

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
